Title: HR Data Analytics and Reporting Manager
Description:
Unleash Your HR Analytics Expertise: HR Data Analytics & Report Manager Do you thrive on transforming raw data into actionable insights that shape business decisions? Are you passionate about using HR analytics to build a stronger, more engaged workforce?

If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! We're seeking a talented and driven HR Data Analytics & Report Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in driving strategic decision-making through data-driven HR insights. In this role, you'll have a meaningful and visible impact in taking reporting and analytics projects from their infancy and growing them into impactful, actionable business initiatives!

Your "Why": Our company values a collaborative and supportive culture where there's no red-tape and leadership is supportive and accessible. Our top-down approach to a positive company culture is evident not only in the standard annual rewards and bonuses, but in the fun events we have for our team members. Join us!

Duties/ Responsibilities:

Develop and implement a reporting strategy to measure the impact of HR metrics. This includes collaborating with HR and Operations to understand business priorities and develop reports that support achieving those priorities. Analyze data, interpret trends, and create reports using multiple data sources. This includes using critical thinking and assessment skills to identify problems and develop corrective actions. Develop and maintain reporting dashboards and data visualizations. This includes using data visualization tools to create clear and concise reports that communicate complex data findings to a variety of audiences. Manage report requests, access, and user permissions. This includes establishing a system for receiving report requests, maintaining a catalog of available reports, and developing and maintaining report writer procedures. Maintain data confidentiality. This includes following all applicable laws and regulations to protect the privacy of employee data. 

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in relevant field (Information Systems, Business, HR, etc.) OR equivalent in related work experience. Minimum 5 years of HRIS experience. 

Technical Skills:

Workday expertise including Prism, People Analytics, Management Reporter. Data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI. Programming languages like R and Python (preferred). Database management and security proficiency. 

Soft Skills:

Strong communication, consultation, and critical thinking. Responsibilities to build partnerships across different teams. Detail-oriented with independent judgment. Continuous improvement mindset. Microsoft Office Suite proficiency. 

Salary: $105,000-$130,000/year

Title: Senior Manager, Analytics
Description:
Overview

About Annalect

Annalect’s 2,000+ innovators leverage data and technology to help clients across Omnicom build relationships that matter — whether that means fostering consumers’ trust in brands, building new experiences, or delivering advanced analytics where it’s most needed. Annalect is the driving force behind Omni, Omnicom’s unique open operating system, which works hand-in-hand with clients’ and partners’ data and tools, to orchestrate better marketing outcomes.

Annalect’s unique approach to data and technology – one that relies on transparency, neutrality, and interoperability – allows us to deliver purpose-built and scalable solutions that make data actionable. Our advanced teams of product leaders, data scientists, consultants, and engineers enable us to meet the business goals of our internal and external clients.

Team Overview

This team drives the Analytics practice for one of Annalect’s most important clients. The Director will work cross-functionally with a highly engaged team of domain experts that deliver unique and innovative solutions and insights. In this position, your expertise will be valued and acknowledged by your peers in an organization that prioritizes collaboration and work/life balance.

 Please note: This role will require an in-office presence; minimum of 3 days per week. 

Qualifications

Required Skills and Qualifications

 3+ years of experience in a quantitative data driven field, marketing/media analytics, or other relevant field.  Strong excel skills (Leveraging features, Pivot Tables, Macros, and other advanced functions).  Hands-on experience and proficiency in SQL, R, and/or Python a bonus, but not a requirement.  Excellent communication skills are a must, especially client communication.  Ability to work well with others and work in cross functional teams.  Ability to move beyond descriptive analytics and employ more sophisticated techniques (prescriptive analytics and statistical methods).  Understanding and familiarity of the marketing and digital media landscape, including nuance within media platforms and technology, SEO, owned social, PR, events, direct marketing, and sales optimization and analytics.  Able to learn and work independently and autonomously, be self-driven, but always collaborating. 

Preferred

 Experience with data visualization platforms and BI tools such as Datorama, Tableau, Looker, or DataStudio  Understanding of marketing mix modeling/econometric analysis and/or other branches of market research (custom survey research, advertising testing or tracking, new product research, etc.)  Audience strategy and measurement  Prior agency experience  Experience delivering and operationalizing reporting solutions for clients. 

Responsibilities

Position Overview:

As a Sr. Manager on Annalect’s Analytics team, you will be tasked with aiding in the transformation of vast data sets into compelling and actionable insights. You will also work closely with leadership to collaborate across teams/agencies and participate in cross-channel analyses. Through data-driven insights, you will have the opportunity to shape the strategic direction of a client’s marketing strategy.

Key Responsibilities

 Translate data into clear, compelling, and actionable insights by leveraging advanced analytics tactics conducted by central resources.  Generate and communicate clear, compelling data analysis with actionable insights; construct insightful narratives through sophisticated analytic techniques.  Support the organization in analytics capabilities, including data visualization; campaign dashboarding, reporting, and data services.  Assisting in the development of audience analytics, through audience & segmentation consistencies, research collaboration and insights extending performance reporting approach for audience insights  Help develop and understand complex cross-channel marketing measurement plans.  Evaluate effects on marketing optimizations across different and disparate marketing channels.  Communicate deep analytics insights in a client-friendly way. 

Perks of working at Annalect

 Culture! We have an incredibly fun, collaborative environment that encourages engagement and work/life balance  Generous PTO that includes vacation days, personal days, a fantastic Summer Friday program and extended time off around the holiday season.  As part of Omnicom, we have the backing and resources of a global billion-dollar company, but also have the flexibility and pace of a “startup” - we move fast, break things, and innovate.

Title: HR Insights and Analytics Manager
Description:
Introduction

Introduction to the job

Make a difference to the efficiency and profitability of the company by determining together with the HR line and business what the added value of actionable, data driven workforce insights in the several areas could be. To achieve this, you will be using your unique mix of technical, analytical, business acumen, creative and strong interpersonal skills to make the insights really actionable for the end-users.

As People Analytics specialist at ASML, you will collect, compile, and analyze HR and workforce data and apply statistical / analytical models to derive actionable insights. In this way you support the HR line, business and other HR expertise areas to make clear recommendations related to for example recruitment, inclusion, rewards, workforce planning or retention. As the key specialist in the US market, you are responsible to translate the US needs to the possible people analytics solutions.

Role And Responsibilities
Prioritize People Analytics requests and needs from the local US expertise teams (e.g. talent acquisition and compensation & benefits) and HR line / business partners into practical people analytics insights. This could be both leading to scalable products and one-off insights. Create a US People Analytics roadmap with support of, and in alignment with, the global People Analytics expertise team. Bring priorities based on value / effort principles.Manage execution of US roadmap, in collaboration with global People Analytics team specialists and US business owners. Part of this also entails the tradeoff between prioritizing ad-hoc demand above planned demand.Execute hands-on people analytics solution building tasks: From data engineering to developing analytics and statistical models to translating and visualizing (in dashboards or reports) these insights into actionable output for the end-users. Identify and act upon ‘people analytics value drivers’ relevant for the US teams to further increase impact of the existing and to be build people analytics solutions. Have an understanding of the impact of data privacy and (upcoming) AI regulation as well as compliance with employment laws on the feasibility of possible people analytics solutions.


Education And Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Actuarial Sciences, Mathematics, IT, or related field required.Experience in Information Management, Business Management, Economics, Econometrics, Data Science, Computer Science & Engineering, Mathematics & Computer Science but also Robotics & Applied Mathematics or equivalent.Experience in the HR function highly desired. 


Skills
Internal drive for efficiency and able to work disciplined and accurate. Pragmatic, pro-active, ‘self-propelling’ way of working and able to operate in a dynamic environment. Take responsibility: say what you do and do what you say . Explain and present technical matters within team and can zoom out to oversee the bigger picture through effective written/verbal communication and presentation skills.Strong business and human resources acumen, understanding internal and external market forces, operating priorities and Finance/ROI.Effectively manage and influence stakeholders.Demonstrates independence and consultative approach.Demonstrated organizational skills with exceptional attention to detail. 


Diversity and inclusion

We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Title: Senior Data Strategist - Consumer
Description:
At GREY, we create Famously Effective ideas – creativity that delivers business results – for the world’s most influential brands. Our core values – creativity, unity, empathy, and service – power the work we do in each of our 40+ studios across six continents.

In 2023, we were named a Top 100 Most Loved Workplace and our agency network, The Grey Group, ranked in the top ten award winners at the Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity

Position Overview

Data Strategy is an integral division within the Strategy team at Grey. Our Senior Data Strategists lead clients and teams through a journey of human-centered research to discover insights and inspiration and contribute to all phases of the strategic process. This unique role is a blend of creative and analytical thinking that deploys various tools and techniques that inspire creative communication and help clients better understand their target audience, map their experiences, size market opportunities, measure and optimize brand performance - all rooted in data-driven strategic insights. Our Senior Data Strategist are partnered with our Planning in a 1:1 relationship, mirroring the relationship of art direction and copy. We feel that data must live at the core of everything we do to ensure we are making Famously Effective Work.

Key Responsibilities

Build audience profiles based off various syndicated and proprietary tools (Resonate, Global Web Index, Brandwatch, AYTM, Google Insights Finder, etc.). Lead social media reporting in collaboration with our community management team. Design and plan creative research, including survey design, audience screening, focus groups, hypothesis testing through qualitative/quantitative analysis, etc. Synthesize research findings to uncover and articulate insights that will inspire strategy and inform the creative briefs - Data Strategists must be able to lead the team (and the client) through the analysis and synthesis processes, distilling down to focus on the most important insights and linking them together in a strategic framework. Collaborate with teams and ideate on insights to create strategic opportunities for innovative brand and product experiences. Data Strategists are responsible for guiding client teams to define campaign objectives that ladder up to business goals and recommend tracking techniques using a variety of tools to measure KPIs that help determine how we optimize. Develop a deeper understanding of the target audiences, consumer journeys, identifying both in-category and out of category opportunities for brands. Educate clients on the value of data-driven services for their business, helping them define and quantify needs and offering potential solutions. Pro-actively engage with other specialty and new business teams across Grey's network, to strengthen the Grey data strategy framework, cultivate new opportunities, and activate compelling insights into action. 

WHAT YOU WILL NEED: 

Creative critical thinking and problem-solving skillsStrong comfort with Excel including the ability to perform functions like pivot tables and basic formulasPrior experience with social media management tools like Sprinklr, Sprout, Emplifi, Brandwatch, etc. Ability to conduct social listening analyses leveraging tools like Infegy, Netbase, or BrandwatchIntellectual curiosity and a desire to learn new Technical skills with some degree of autonomy (ie. SQL, Tableau)A foundational knowledge of statisticsThe interpersonal skills to inspire and selflessly elevate the creative productA team mentality - succeed when the overall team succeeds3-6 years of experience in an agency, marketing, or financial analysis background setting preferredFor consideration: at least 2-3 years in a data or insights-specific role
NICE TO HAVE:

Build measurement strategies for brand campaigns across channels including digital, social, website, and CRM. The eye to recognize a great idea when they see it, and the experience to know how to make it better. The skills needed to orchestrate, and the knowledge to direct the application of the different disciplines, resources, and personalities seamlessly. Be a driver to create new data-led projects across clients within Grey by providing thought leadership on innovative data-driven solutions such as brand sentiment studies, category trends opportunities, MMM etc. Interested in AI , computer science, or automation and how it pertains to digital marketing. 

WHO YOU ARE:

Creative: Putting together two things to create a third thing no one’s ever seen beforeProductive: Acting on ideas to make things happen and get stuff doneCollaborative: Focused on the greater good versus personal gainAdaptable: Ready and able to embrace changeKind: Amicable and considerate of others

Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Our Approach to Work

We lead with flexibility and choice in all of our people programs. We have disrupted the traditional view that all employees have the same needs and wants. We offer personalization and offer our employees the opportunity to choose what works best for them as often as possible - from your wellbeing support to your growth and development, and beyond!

At Palo Alto Networks, we believe in the power of collaboration and value in-person interactions. This is why our employees generally work from the office three days per week, leaving two days for choice and flexibility to work where you feel most effective. This setup fosters casual conversations, problem-solving, and trusted relationships. While details may evolve, our goal is to create an environment where innovation thrives, with office-based teams coming together three days a week to collaborate and thrive, together!

Job Description

Your Career

The People Analytics team at Palo Alto Networks is dedicated to understanding and enhancing our most valuable asset, our employees. We focus on providing insights that connect people and performance with business outcomes, particularly in areas like recruiting, employee engagement, organizational health, and workforce planning. In our journey to achieve these goals, we are looking for a People Analytics Specialist, Employee Listening, to join our team.

As a People Analytics Specialist, Employee Listening, your role will be to spearhead our Employee Listening initiatives. You'll work closely with key stakeholders across the People Team to develop and implement strategies and visions for understanding sentiment throughout the employee lifecycle. Your mission will be to gather and integrate insights that will inform decisions impacting employee engagement and satisfaction.

This role is based in our HQ-Santa Clara, CA.

Your Impact

Lead and execute Employee Listening strategies, aligning them with the broader goals of the People TeamPartner with stakeholders to identify and understand key employee concerns and sentimentsUtilize a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods to gather, analyze, and interpret employee feedbackDevelop and maintain systems for continuous employee feedback, ensuring data is effectively captured and analyzedPresent findings to stakeholders, translating complex data into compelling narratives that drive action and changeCollaborate with IT and data engineering teams to optimize data collection and analysis processesImplement and measure the effectiveness of employee listening initiatives, adapting strategies as needed based on feedback and resultsStay updated on the latest trends and best practices in employee listening and engagement, integrating innovative approaches into our strategies

Qualifications

Your Experience

The Team

Our People team works throughout the organization to enable ... you guessed it: people. We’re one team, driven to one mission statement. Each piece matters, and within the People team, you are focused on enabling our teams to resolve the world’s most challenging cybersecurity threats.

You will be part of a growing, passionate, and dynamic team with an opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects — centered on what we believe is one of the most significant mission statements in the world.

Title: Director of Data & Analytics
Description:
At AIM Consulting, we are a focused, energetic group of people working together with passion, enthusiasm, and commitment to being an industry leader in technology consulting services. We lead by developing and maintaining long-term relationships with our consultants and clients. We invest in our employees, fostering career growth by enabling access to training, encouraging personal development, and by providing mentorship. All our employees are encouraged to be creative and are driven to succeed. We value honest communication, reward performance, and produce high quality results and happy clients. Our days are competitive, fast, fun, and exciting. In addition to an annual salary, all of our full-time positions at AIM Consulting include the following: Lucrative Bonus Potential with YoY growth, Medical, Dental and Vision insurance (spousal and dependent coverage), 401k with company matching, paid certifications, disability insurance, commuter benefits, paid time off and sick days, paid maternity and paternity leave, and wellness programs.
We are looking for an experienced Consulting Leader to assist us in building out our Data & Analytics Practice in Minneapolis. AIM focuses on architecting modern, trustworthy data platforms to deliver actionable insights using business intelligence, machine learning, and data science.
Our goal is to turn insights into action through modernization of our clients’ data architectures. Data has exploded with the advent of cloud, big data technologies, the internet of things, and an increasing appetite for advanced business insights. But not all data is created equal! We help companies strategize, design, build, and operationalize data and analytics platforms through our high-performing solutions and teams of data engineers, architects, data scientists, and analysts.
We need a hands-on leader who has significant experience building enterprise-class cloud-based (AWS, GCP, Azure, and Snowflake) big data and machine learning architectures and loves mentoring and partnering with organizations to extract value out of their data assets. This role will primarily focus on Minneapolis but may include work remotely in any of AIM’s offices throughout the United States. It will require someone willing to travel within Minneapolis and surrounding Twin Cities area.
With the many changes and growth occurring in Data & Analytics are you getting exposure to various methodologies, architectures, platforms, and tools? Do you enjoy talking with clients from different industries? Are you excited to build a team of folks in your community that can help customers in their same community? AIM may be your dream job!
Day-to-day, you will be responsible for:Defining Strategy – Create plans annually and refine quarterly. Plans will include technology and services, financials, and growth targets.Thought Leadership – Maintain an asset library of content (articles, reference architectures, case studies, presentations, etc.) that is vital to our Practices’ success. Work with other thought leaders to create content to fill gaps. Continue to update content to make sure it’s relevant.Mentorship and Guidance – Hire and grow your people. Help them achieve career objectives and find new ways to support the business. Sharing industry-standard best practices, or modern architectural improvements.Technology Education – Create programs to continue to educate our teams. Focus on areas of poor performance or new technology. Make investments in hands-on workshops and certifications.Sales Support – Creating compelling and differentiating proposals. To do so, requires multiple hands-on discovery sessions with both AIM and client resources. Gathering all of the requirements is critical to creating dynamic proposals that resonate with potential clients.Statements of Work – Work is done based off contracts that have been mutually agreed upon. You will be working with others to create these contracts, based on client conversations and discovery sessions. Knowing what’s in and out of scope, as well as the expectations of milestones and release schedules is required.Project Estimation – Being able to estimate work items, create a product roadmap, define an adequate team composition, and estimate costs.Continuous Improvement – You should be focused on continually learning and increasing your value both individually and collectively. Using retrospectives to help you understand where you have room to grow and capitalizing on it.Community Development – Organizing and leading discussions and events within the organization. Creating workshops, sharing projects, collaborating on process improvements.Interviewing – Making sure we select the right people to make AIM successful is huge. We need our senior people to help us weed out those that aren’t right for AIM, and make sure we don’t miss out on those that will make us even better.Execution – You will be deeply involved in the execution of the engagements that you work with clients to define. This may include being immersed in developing a platform strategy, leading a team of data engineers and scientists rolling out a new platform, or helping a company centralize their data on Azure, AWS, Snowflake, or GCP.
About you:You are an achievement-oriented data and analytics leader who strongly desires continued growth and leadership opportunities. You have excellent negotiation, conflict management, problem-solving, and decision-making skills with a proven track record of client engagement satisfaction. You are driven to deliver excellent products and have a consistently high level of customer service.
Your knowledge and skillset likely include the following:Consulting Experience: 10+ years of experience as a consultant or consulting leader involved in the relationship development, solution selling, proposal development, contract negotiation, onboarding, and delivery of client work. Managerial Experience: 5+ years of experience managing people including: hiring, mentoring, and retaining data engineers, analysts, and scientists.Project Leadership: Minimum 5+ years of experience leading projects that have big data/analytics/data science components using modern approaches on Cloud Based (AWS, Azure, GCP, Snowflake) data platforms.Technical Community Presence - Must have built a local network of relationships within the Minneapolis market.Communication - Highly effective communication skills with client-facing and executive-level management.Knowledge Sharing - Experience developing presentations and delivering them to large audiences on topics related to artificial intelligence, machine learning, data architecture and big data.Calm in the Storm - Ability to prioritize and manage multiple competing responsibilities – while delivering quality outcomes to respective client organizations and teams.
Technical Skills – Must Haves:·10+ years of development experience in data strategy, data architecture & engineering patterns, data science & machine learning methodologies. Our leaders are deep practitioners and hands-on.·5+ years of enterprise experience with cloud platforms and development patterns (AWS, Azure, Snowflake, GCP, Cloudera)·5+ years of experience working with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Azure Data Lake)·Experience building data pipelines and utilizing ETL tools (SSIS, Informatica, Talend, SAP Data Services)·Experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Spotfire)
Technical Skills – Nice to Haves·Experience with data governance frameworks (DAMA, DCAM)·Experience with master data management platforms and architecting data domains (Informatica, Profisee, TIBCO EBX)·Familiarity with the following disciplines: machine learning, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, bayes theorem·Familiarity with analytics platforms (Azure ML, TensorFlow, Pega, IBM Watson)
At AIM Consulting, we value people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one, and that’s okay. We are heavily invested in further education and training, and we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace where you can show up as your true self. If you’re passionate about technology, but your previous experience doesn’t perfectly align with every qualification listed, we still encourage you to apply.
We are a diverse group of individuals. No two people, ideologies, or thoughts are the same. Our different experiences and perspectives are our strengths. We are passionate about seeing each other succeed and live & breathe our company values; we choose positivity, we take ownership, we are relationship-driven, we build trust, and we are self-aware. We work hard to come through for our clients and also for one another. We are many unique people with the same common goal in mind – to connect, inspire, and empower our customers by leveraging an amazing workforce to help solve business challenges, drive innovation, and produce results that exceed expectations. Simply put, we are more than a company; we are our client’s trusted advisors.

AIM Consulting provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. AIM Consulting complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

  • Thought Leadership – Maintain an asset library of content (articles, reference architectures, case studies, presentations, etc.) that is vital to our Practices’ success. Work with other thought leaders to create content to fill gaps. Continue to update content to make sure it’s relevant.
  • Mentorship and Guidance – Hire and grow your people. Help them achieve career objectives and find new ways to support the business. Sharing industry-standard best practices, or modern architectural improvements.
  • Technology Education – Create programs to continue to educate our teams. Focus on areas of poor performance or new technology. Make investments in hands-on workshops and certifications.
  • Sales Support – Creating compelling and differentiating proposals. To do so, requires multiple hands-on discovery sessions with both AIM and client resources. Gathering all of the requirements is critical to creating dynamic proposals that resonate with potential clients.
  • Statements of Work – Work is done based off contracts that have been mutually agreed upon. You will be working with others to create these contracts, based on client conversations and discovery sessions. Knowing what’s in and out of scope, as well as the expectations of milestones and release schedules is required.
  • Project Estimation – Being able to estimate work items, create a product roadmap, define an adequate team composition, and estimate costs.
  • Continuous Improvement – You should be focused on continually learning and increasing your value both individually and collectively. Using retrospectives to help you understand where you have room to grow and capitalizing on it.
  • Community Development – Organizing and leading discussions and events within the organization. Creating workshops, sharing projects, collaborating on process improvements.
  • Interviewing – Making sure we select the right people to make AIM successful is huge. We need our senior people to help us weed out those that aren’t right for AIM, and make sure we don’t miss out on those that will make us even better.
  • Execution – You will be deeply involved in the execution of the engagements that you work with clients to define. This may include being immersed in developing a platform strategy, leading a team of data engineers and scientists rolling out a new platform, or helping a company centralize their data on Azure, AWS, Snowflake, or GCP.

About you:

You are an achievement-oriented data and analytics leader who strongly desires continued growth and leadership opportunities. You have excellent negotiation, conflict management, problem-solving, and decision-making skills with a proven track record of client engagement satisfaction. You are driven to deliver excellent products and have a consistently high level of customer service.

Your knowledge and skillset likely include the following:

Consulting Experience: 10+ years of experience as a consultant or consulting leader involved in the relationship development, solution selling, proposal development, contract negotiation, onboarding, and delivery of client work.

Managerial Experience: 5+ years of experience managing people including: hiring, mentoring, and retaining data engineers, analysts, and scientists.

Project Leadership: Minimum 5+ years of experience leading projects that have big data/analytics/data science components using modern approaches on Cloud Based (AWS, Azure, GCP, Snowflake) data platforms.

Technical Community Presence - Must have built a local network of relationships within the Minneapolis market.

Communication - Highly effective communication skills with client-facing and executive-level management.

Knowledge Sharing - Experience developing presentations and delivering them to large audiences on topics related to artificial intelligence, machine learning, data architecture and big data.

Calm in the Storm - Ability to prioritize and manage multiple competing responsibilities – while delivering quality outcomes to respective client organizations and teams.

·10+ years of development experience in data strategy, data architecture & engineering patterns, data science & machine learning methodologies. Our leaders are deep practitioners and hands-on.

·5+ years of enterprise experience with cloud platforms and development patterns (AWS, Azure, Snowflake, GCP, Cloudera)

·5+ years of experience working with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Azure Data Lake)

Who We Look For

An SEI-er is a master communicator and active listener who understands how to navigate an audience. Self-aware, almost to a fault, SEI-ers keenly understand how to adjust their support and problem solving based on the situation. Following a logical, fact-based approach, SEI-ers possess the superior ability to see correlations others may not, ask the right questions and drive solutions.

As super-connectors, they connect not only people, but data, trends and experiences. Mature, humble, and genuine, SEI-ers frequently go above and beyond for both their clients and their colleagues. SEI-ers are ethical and trustworthy individuals who consistently and repeatedly follow through, and hold true to their values in difficult situations. SEI-ers have an insatiable curiosity and love to learn. These individuals are commonly tech savvy and early adopters. Their passion for learning is infectious and excites others. As every project is different, an SEI-er must be adaptable and comfortable with unexpected situations. SEI-ers define ambition differently. They are authentic, low-maintenance individuals who truly enjoy one another- they like to hang out with colleagues outside of work, collaborate and hold one another accountable. SEI-ers enjoy working with genuine, thoughtful folks who want to steer clear of the traditional grind and share the joy of day-to-day life and activities with colleagues, friends, and family.

What We Do

Our Data and Analytics consultants work with clients at all levels of the organization, from the C-suite to the shop floor, helping them to deliver on their most strategic initiatives. We’re known for making realistic, data-driven decisions that deliver value in tangible ways to our clients. Our clients ask for us on projects that require a superior combination of technical and business capabilities, people and management skills, and a collaborative mindset. We excel in understanding complex programs and strategic initiatives and breaking them into actionable pieces.

We are actively looking for professionals in the following areas:

Data StrategyData GovernanceData ModernizationAdvanced AnalyticsData Visualization

Have experience understanding and solving real business problemsHave experience with presenting business case and strategy to the C-SuiteBring industry domain knowledge for custom data and analytics strategiesExperience in designing and implementing data driven products and servicesExperience in designing and building high performance collaborative business and technology teams that deliver high value data solutions, data products and data analytics

Data Strategy and Governance

Intimately familiar with data technologies, data architecture frameworks, cloud platforms and the emerging trends in technological advancements. Proven experience in transforming our clients from on-prem data platforms to the cloud. Lead data modernization initiatives that include platform, technology and tools implementation and adoption. Must have experience in architecting and implementing data architecture, data engineering, reporting and analytical solutions across multiple business functions and domains. Conduct data management maturity assessments and identify pain points for including data quality, governance, architecture, analytics, metadata management, master data management. Demonstrate a rigorous and analytical problem-solving approach, leading information-gathering sessions and preparing and delivering client presentations and work products/prototypes. Identify data governance gaps and assess data governance maturity in a complex data environment. Should also be able to Identify the implications for data governance that arise from the technology, current processes, and skill levels in a complex data environment. 

Data Architecture and Engineering

Extensive experience or knowledge of cloud-based data platform technologies such as AWS, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Computing. Title: Senior Data Science Consultant
Description:
At Slalom, personal connection meets global scale. Our vision is to enable a world in which everyone loves their work and life. We help organizations of all kinds redefine what’s possible, give shape to the future—and get there.

Slalom is seeking a data scientist to join our local Dallas-Fort Worth team. You will help evangelize and deliver cutting-edge data solutions for our most important customers across the metroplex. You have hands-on expertise with leading technologies for building applications powered by Python, cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), and may have AI expertise. You realize code and data are just the start…you’ve built applications and operated them in production environments with actual usage. You’ve told stories about how use cases connect to business outcomes and working with stakeholders to support adoption. You blend expertise with empathy, teamwork, and mentoring to build lasting relationships resulting in customer success and growth.

This role is based in the Dallas-Fort Worth area only.

Who You’ll Work With

As a modern technology company, we've never met a business challenge we didn't like. We enable our clients to learn from their data, create incredible digital experiences, and make the most of new technologies. We blend design, engineering, and analytics expertise to build the future. We surround our consultants with interesting challenges, innovative minds, and emerging technologies.

What You’ll Do

Apply fundamental and advanced quantitative methods, including machine learning and statistical modeling, to solve complex business problems and enable data-driven decision making (e.g., build statistical and machine learning models for trend analysis and forecasting to predict future business outcomes for a Fortune 100 company). Efficiently synthesize large volumes of data, extracting meaningful insights in a structured and programmatic manner. Create effective data visualizations to simplify and clarify complex data patterns and trends and explain these complex concepts and business value to non-technical stakeholders. Work with a team of data professionals to integrate diverse data sources, establishing a comprehensive and unified view of the client's data landscape. Lead and participate in solutioning sessions, working hand-in-hand with business/client, translating business objectives into actionable machine learning/data science use case.

What You’ll Bring

Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in data science. Strong proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and experience with libraries/frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn. Experience with cloud and modern data science tools and platforms such as Databricks MLFlow, GCP BigQuery, AWS SageMaker, Kubeflow, and Azure ML. Experience building end-to-end data science solutions, including operationalizing models. Preferred but not required: Prior formal experience in a leadership role. The ability to guide and manage a team effectively would be highly advantageous. 

About Us

Slalom is a purpose-led, global business and technology consulting company. From strategy to implementation, our approach is fiercely human. In six countries and 43 markets, we deeply understand our customers—and their customers—to deliver practical, end-to-end solutions that drive meaningful impact. Backed by close partnerships with over 400 leading technology providers, our 13,000+ strong team helps people and organizations dream bigger, move faster, and build better tomorrows for all. We’re honored to be consistently recognized as a great place to work, including being one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For seven years running. Learn more at slalom.com.

Title: Data Analytics Manager
Description:
Job Description

Your role at Samsonite:

The Data Analytics Manager (the “DAM”) is primarily responsible for supporting the Global Brand and Corporate Finance teams in developing and executing their data analytics program. In addition, the DAM will support the Global Brand team members in using business data and statistical methods to provide insight into business performance and suggest areas and methods of improving operations. The DAM will need to independently work to navigate complex concepts/data sources, manage big data, and anticipate upcoming challenges within the data space to provide viable solutions. The DAM will also work closely with the Global Brand and Corporate Finance teams, and business leaders across the company to identify and implement high-quality, data-driven reporting. The ideal candidate has a knack for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and the business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for the Company. The DAM is a highly visible position within the organization, providing value add solutions to global business partners. In addition, the ideal candidate will be able to support multiple teams and concurring projects.

 Support Global Brand and Corporate Finance team members in the optimization of data intake, validation, mining and engineering, as well as modeling, visualization and communication of deliverables. Implement tools and strategies to translate raw data into valuable/actionable business insights through data visualization. Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support key business decisions. Design and implement processes for complex, large-scale data mining and predictive modeling. Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective project management and collaboration with stakeholders. Lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities. Keep up on emerging topics and trends in the data analytics domain Advise organizational leadership on the availability and need of upgrades to key systems (e.g., Power BI, Alteryx, Tableau, etc.) Effectively communicate results and business impacts of insight initiatives to Senior management and other stakeholders within the Company. Develop strong working relationships with all levels of management and be viewed as a trusted business partner.

You will work on-site 4 days per week with the opportunity to work remotely one day per week.

About Us

Who we are:

Samsonite is the worldwide leader in superior travel bags, luggage, and accessories combining notable style with the latest design technology and the utmost attention to quality and durability. For more than 100 years, Samsonite has leveraged its rich heritage to create unparalleled products that fulfill the travel lifestyle needs of conscious movers everywhere. With a portfolio of brands including Samsonite, Tumi, American Tourister, High Sierra, Gregory, eBags, Hartmann, and Lipault Paris, our products are sold in over 100 countries in North America, Asia, Europe and Latin America through our company-operated retail store, websites and a variety of retail partners.

Organization

Why You'll Love Working Here

Our employees matter. As a people-focused business, we work hard to provide meaningful rewards and development opportunities for our employees, recognizing performance, and creating a supportive working environment for them, wherever they are based.Vibrant culture. We are committed to a diverse and rich culture, welcoming people from all walks of life. Our long-standing commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers us to bring our authentic selves and unique differences to work every day.Socially responsible. We want to minimize our products' impact on the environment and help create positive journeys worldwide. We do this by creating the best products using the most sustainable and innovative materials, methods, and models. 

What We Value

At Samsonite, we do more than create the bags that move with our consumer, we inspire and celebrate the moments that move them. We believe we have a responsibility to the world in how we operate, the products we sell, the communities where we live and work, and how we treat the people we employ. We're as diverse as travel itself, and like travel, your journey with Samsonite presents the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and explore your passions. This is why we offer various paths for professionals and celebrate the knowledge and skills they bring to our team. We are committed to a respectful workplace that allows our team members to bring their best selves to the workplace daily.

Samsonite is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to promoting and maintaining a work environment in which all applicants, associates, customers, and other individuals are treated with dignity and respect free from unlawful harassment, discrimination, or retaliation.

Title: Vice President, Data
Description:
Who We Are

At CarGurus (NASDAQ: CARG), our mission is to give people the power to reach their destination. We started as a small team of developers determined to bring trust and transparency to car shopping. Since then, our history of innovation and go-to-market acceleration has driven industry-leading growth. In fact, we’re the largest and fastest-growing automotive marketplace, and we’ve been profitable for over 15 years.

What We Do

The market is evolving, and we are too, moving the entire automotive journey online and guiding our customers through every step. That includes everything from the sale of an old car to the financing, purchase, and delivery of a new one. Today, tens of millions of consumers visit CarGurus.com each month, and ~30,000 dealerships use our products. But they're not the only ones who love CarGurus—our employees do, too. We have a people-first culture that fosters kindness, collaboration, and innovation, and empowers our Gurus with tools to fuel their career growth. Disrupting a trillion-dollar industry requires fresh and diverse perspectives. Come join us for the ride!

Role Overview

We’re looking for a technical and business leader to lead our Data teams, inclusive of Data Science, Data Engineering and Product Data Analytics, and to join our Senior Management Team (SMT).

Our Data teams solve a variety of unique challenges, from designing complex data structures and algorithms to machine learning and data analytics. We deploy code daily and use data to power our product and drive our decisions, while delivering software and analytics to consumers and dealers around the world. With our vast network of dealers our data provides us with many unique opportunities to deliver consumer and dealer insights.

Our Data teams focus on providing infrastructure, frameworks and tools for product development engineering teams at CarGurus. Data Engineering is responsible for democratizing data to our analytics teams, as well as data governance and our data platforms. Data Science draws new and unique insights through machine learning that drives the efficacy and value of our product to customers and dealers. And Product Data Analytics derives insights for leadership and our teams that enable fast and high quality decision-making.

This is a high visibility role that reports directly to the CTO.

What You'll Do

Be an active, decisive, strategic voice and advocate on the CarGurus Senior Management Team, driving our data vision forward, all while improving the quality of our decision makingDesign, build and drive overall strategy, methodology, and roadmaps for processes, systems, tools and capabilities required to produce and maintain our core data assets, in a highly iterative environmentWork closely and collaborate with functional and business stakeholders to synthesize and provide guidance on overall system design and architecture, drive business, and ensure that each treats data as a first-class citizen in their systems and applicationsOversee the development and implementation of enterprise and client-facing data management strategies to collect, store and increase usability and quality of enterprise and client data from multiple diverse sources.Oversee the development and maintenance of site-instrumentation and tracking platforms and tools, and ensure they are scalable, reliable, and secureStay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in the data space, and leverage that knowledge to identify new opportunities and best practices that can improve the company's data capabilitiesBe responsible for the leadership, management, and growth of employees at varying levels within the organization Lead and manage teams responsible for designing, analyzing, and facilitating A/B testing and multivariate testing, as well as implementing new testing methodologies to optimize website and product performanceLead and manage teams responsible for deploying machine learning models into production and building services that integrate data-driven intelligence into the site

What You'll Bring

10+ years of experience running data teamsDynamic leadership and management experience of multi-disciplined, technology teams with various prioritiesA deep understanding and passion for solving complex system and data challenges and desire to thrive in a constantly innovating, changing and collaborative environmentPast experience as a technical expert in engineering, data analytics, BI, machine learning, data science, etc prior to leadership/managementExperience with Snowflake, Snowplow, DBT, Fivetran, Sagemaker, Looker, Tableau or other similar data technologyPassion for providing people mentorship and be able to review critical code/designsA deep understanding of data infrastructure, systems, and tools, as well as experience building and managing large-scale data platformsA strong track record of delivering results, and are able to effectively prioritize and manage multiple competing priorities across different business unitsPassion for experimentation and optimization, and are always looking for ways to innovate and improve testing frameworks and methodologiesA deep understanding of site-instrumentation, user journey tracking, site-tracking, and clickstream logging systems, as well as experience building and managing large-scale tracking platformsExperience developing and implementing large scalable systems, best practices and standards for data management, governance, and security, and have a strong understanding of industry standards and regulationsExperience managing teams that develop and deploy predictive models and algorithms–you have worked with teams that design and implement machine learning pipelines, across the full ML lifecycle including R&D, model training, and deployment into production services integrated into a product Demonstrated experience in managing the entire core data tech stack, from data ingestion and storage to processing and analysis, and deploying data products and services in a scalable and reliable manner

Working at CarGurus

We reward our Gurus’ curiosity and passion with best-in-class benefits and compensation, including equity for all employees, both when they start and as they continue to grow with us. Our career development and corporate giving programs, as well as our employee resource groups (ERGs) and communities, help people build connections while making an impact in personally meaningful ways. A flexible hybrid model and robust time off policies encourage work-life balance and individual well-being. Thoughtful perks like daily free lunch, a new car discount, meditation and fitness apps, commuting cost coverage, and more help our people create space for what matters most in their personal and professional lives.

We welcome all

CarGurus strives to be a place to which people can bring the ultimate expression of themselves and their potential—starting with our hiring process. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. We foster an inclusive environment that values people for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. That’s why we hope you’ll apply even if you don’t check every box listed in the job description. We want to know what only you can bring to CarGurus.
